chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark J. Trefren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
TIME SERVED

MT must surrender all firearms or show proof that firearms are no longer in his name to RCSD.

records.addlTxt:
4:40 PM Defendant Mark J. Trefren in court, in custody.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eric P Habich in court for Mark J. Trefren. Attorney Habich informs the court that there is a joint agreement of time served with 62 or 63 days served. Court finds a factual basis. Victim comments. Attorney Forehand asks that the court follow the joint recommendations. Attorney Habich heard. MT speaks. Court comments.

Court orders: 
63 days in the Richland County Jail.
TIME SERVED.
Court costs with 60 dtp.

Felony warnings.

Attorney Forehand asks that MT surrender all firearms into RCSD or show proof that they are in someone else's name.
Court orders surrendering all firearms into RCSD immediately.

Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury selection on September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:06 PM Defendant Mark J. Trefren in court, in custody.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eric P Habich in court for Mark J. Trefren. State filed the information today. Def stands mute for entry of NG on his behalf by Atty. Habich. Atty. Habich requests status and trial scheduling. Court sets FPT for 8/29 at 11 and JT for during week of 9/6-9/9 with JS 9/6 at 9. Jury states TBD after the FPT. 7/25 at 4:15 for status.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury selection scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:30 AM Defendant Mark J. Trefren in court, in custody.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eric P Habich in court for Mark J. Trefren. 

Attorney Habich asks for the bond to be changed to a signature bond with the conditions to allow MT to travel outside of WI for work. 
Attorney Forehand objects to a signature bond and does think a case bond is needed. 
Attorney Habich comments about Attorney Forehand's comments.
Court denies the motion.

Attorney Habich waives the preliminary hearing. MT concurs. Court finds probable cause.
Arraignment scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
for Victim to appear by Zoom

Defendant not to be in the city of Baraboo. Not to have contact with Sauk County DA Mike Albrecht. No contact/communication with the Sauk County DA's office (no calls, mail, email, communication through third party - absolutely no contact/communication). Not to leave the State of Wisconsin.
